learning_objectives.description: Understand how data storage is measured.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Units: bit, nibble, byte, kibibyte (KiB), mebibyte (MiB), gibibyte (GiB), tebibyte (TiB), pebibyte (PiB), exbibyte (EiB). Conversion factors: 8 bits in a byte, 1024 units in the next size up.

learning_objectives.description: Calculate the file size of image and sound files.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Give answers in specified units. Use 1024-based conversion. Input data may include resolution, colour depth, sample rate, bit depth, and duration.

learning_objectives.description: Understand the purpose and need for data compression.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Compression reduces file size, saving bandwidth, storage, and transmission time.

learning_objectives.description: Understand lossy and lossless compression methods.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Lossy removes data permanently (e.g. lowering resolution/sample rate). Lossless compresses without losing information (e.g. run length encoding).
